description:
Akihabara is the center of the universe for the coolest hobbies and quirkiest amusements. In the spring of 1999, bright-eyed Nagomi Wahira moves there with dreams of joining a maid café. She quickly dons an apron at café Ton Tokoton, AKA the Pig Hut. But adjusting to life in bustling Akihabara isn’t as easy as serving tea and delighting customers. Paired with the dour Ranko who never seems to smile, Nagomi must do her best to elevate the Pig Hut over all other maid cafés vying for top ranking. Along the way she’ll slice out a place for herself amid the frills and thrills of life at the Pig Hut. Just when Nagomi’s dreams are within her grasp, she discovers not everything is as it seems amid the maid cafés of Akihabara.

(Source: HIDIVE)

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Features a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers. Also encompasses cafes and bistros.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Homeless
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is homeless.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Gambling
tags.description: Centers around the act of gambling.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Boxing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of boxing.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Poker
tags.description: Centers around the game of poker or its variations.

tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

node.description:
[Website](http://www.ike-yoshihiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikeyoshihiro)

Yoshihiro Ike is a Japanese composer, music arranger, and bassist. He is best known for scoring and composing music for movies, TV dramas, Anime and video games and has worked on more than 100 titles in the last 20 years.

His debut anime title, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), was nominated for the 2000 UK Music Awards under the soundtrack category, and subsequently awarded the top prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2001 by the Agency for Cultural affairs. In 2006, his score for [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/) received an Excellence Prize at the 2005 Japan Media Arts Festival. In 2018, Shadowverse original soundtracks became the highest-ranking album on iTunes, surpassing Shallow by Lady Gaga.

(Source: Wikipedia)
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

__[Profile (Haikyo)](https://haikyo.co.jp/profile/profile.php?ActorID=11916) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/rinasatoh)__

__Non-anime roles:__
- Guilty - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Eula - Genshin Impact (VG)
- USS California - Azur Lane (VG)
- Caesar King - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)
- Helena Martin - Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery (VG)
